stories.text:
We're your typical run-of-the-mill mid-size enterprise software vendor trying to hire for "DevOps" (Linux, containers, yadda yadda) fully-remote SWEs. We post in the usual places including Who's Hiring but we haven't even managed to backfill a retirement from six months ago, and we're junior-heavy already. Benefits and salary are good, and the people are great, though the work requires a reasonably deep understanding of the underlying platforms which a lot of people seem to dislike.

I'm wondering if the work being a higher percentage non-code is what's causing us trouble, if we're just rubbish at hiring in general, or if it's something else.

What's everyone else's experience hiring senior talent in this market, and what is everyone doing to attract seniors to their roles?
stories.title: Ask HN: Having trouble hiring despite good comp, wondering what to do about it?
